title: Grand Theft Auto: San Andreas
notes: Runs great

title: Grand Theft Auto: San Andreas
notes: Throws an error: "Grand Theft Auto SA cannot find Audio card installed"

title: Grand Theft Auto: San Andreas
notes:
- Initially it just doesn't start with error window saying:
"Grand Theft Auto SA cannot find Audio card installed"
- You can fix it by changing Wine Audio to ALSA.
Like here: https://askubuntu.com/a/77282 but with `WINEPREFIX="pathTOyourSTEAM/steamapps/compatdata/12120/pfx"` set. For me winetricks hung at first but after killing all 'wine' and '.exe' things on second try it worked flawlessly.
- After this game launches, fullscreen works, settings work.
- Steam Overlay and Screenshots work! (There is no cursor in Overlay tho :P)
- Saves work
- Alt tabbing works (but once it froze the game on black screen)
- It happened to me that game froze with black screen (and some game text) after: dead and one of the cutscenes - so you might want to skip them ;)
- Missions etc. work
- Overall games run smoothly but is not 100% stable as mentioned earlier.

title: Grand Theft Auto: San Andreas
notes: Initial run stalled during the intro movie.  Attempted again and runs well on max settings (w/AA), though Steam indicates that it's stable at 26FPS (going no lower or higher) and with minor screen tearing (barely noticeable).

title: Grand Theft Auto: San Andreas
notes: Performance is good with all graphical options maxed out. The only glitch worth noticing is that it's really hard to hard-pedal the bike due to slow refresh rate of the keyboard. Otherwise, fully playable.

title: Grand Theft Auto: San Andreas
notes: Can't save the game, it's most likely missing following directory, which has to be created manually: "~/.steam/steam/steamapps/compatdata/12120/pfx/drive_c/users/steamuser/My Documents/"

title: Grand Theft Auto: San Andreas
notes: Crashes on cutscenes while holding controls - WSAD or others (ie driving a car into designated spot during mission) a simple workaround is to just release all buttons before entering/leaving locations and during missions (just before cutscene).

title: Grand Theft Auto: San Andreas
notes: Perfect with integrated Intel graphics. When I run it with primusrun, to use NVIDIA, it freezes just before going in game, after the loading screen progress bar fills up.

title: Grand Theft Auto: San Andreas
notes:
No visible performance penalty and runs as well as it used to on Windows.
The only problem is that you must stop making any input whenever a room or cutscene transition happens, otherwise there's a high chance your game will freeze and you'll need to go to the tty and send Wine a SIGKILL.

title: Grand Theft Auto: San Andreas

notes: I had to disable esync to prevent random freezing/hangups during load screens. No other gameplay impacting bugs are obvious. There are occasional minor graphical and audio glitches/distortions, but nothing unbearable (barely even noticeable to be honest)
